intro: Lastreopsis manilensis, commonly known as the Manila lastreopsis, is a species of flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. It features small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, and its leaves are lance-shaped with a distinct, fragrant odor. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
